intro: Keetia inaequilatera, commonly known as the narrow-leaf keetia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, opposite leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its small, white to pink flowers are typically clustered in dense inflorescences. Keetia inaequilatera is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
